definition: to prick/to run or stick (a needle etc) into/jug (a classifier for liquids such as beer)
to tie/to bind/classifier for flowers, banknotes etc: bundle/Taiwan pr. [zha2]
to prick/to run or stick (a needle etc) into/jug (a classifier for liquids such as beer)
to tie/to bind/classifier for flowers, banknotes etc: bundle/Taiwan pr. [zha2]

sentences.english: Down-to-earth and engage in the management is one of the basic principles of enterprise.
sentences.chinese: “扎扎实实地搞管理”是企业的基本原则之一。

sentences.english: I like your down-to-earth and hardworking spirit.
sentences.chinese: 我就喜欢你们这股扎扎实实埋头苦干的劲儿。

sentences.english: We will continue to make earnest effort to strengthen disaster prevention and mitigation.
sentences.chinese: 我们要继续扎扎实实加强防灾减灾工作。

sentences.english: The international community should take concrete steps to help with Afghanistan's reconstruction.
sentences.chinese: 国际社会也应扎扎实实地帮助阿开展重建工作。

sentences.english: We will continue to make earnest effort to push forward post-disaster rehabilitation and reconstruction.
sentences.chinese: 我们要继续扎扎实实推进灾后恢复重建工作。

definition: one step, one footprint (idiom); steady progress/reliable
pinyin: yi1 bu4 yi1 ge4 jiao3 yin4

definition: to have one's feet firmly planted on the ground (idiom); realistic without flights of fancy/steady and serious character
to seek truth from facts (idiom)/to be practical and realistic
to persevere unremittingly (idiom); to keep going until the end
firmly-based/steady/steadfast/to have peace of mind/free from anxiety/Taiwan pr. [ta4 shi2]
to work industriously/to get things done
